name: Exeggcute
flavorText: Using telepathy only fellow Exeggcute can pick up on, they always form a cluster of six.

attack.name: Precocious Evolution
attack.text: If you go first, you can use this attack during your first turn. Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Exeggcute
flavorText: Using telepathy only fellow Exeggcute can pick up on, they always form a cluster of six.

attack.name: Absorb
attack.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Exeggutor
flavorText: It is said that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.

attack.name: Barrage O’Clock
attack.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to both Active Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Durant ex

abilities.name: Sudden Shearing
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard the top card of your opponent’s deck.

attack.name: Vengeful Crush
attack.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

name: Scatterbug
flavorText: This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder to repel enemies. It will eat different plants depending on where it lives.

attack.name: Call for Family
attack.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Spewpa
flavorText: Spewpa doesn’t live in a fixed location. It roams where it pleases across the fields and mountains, building up the energy it needs to evolve.

attack.name: Wander About
attack.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Vivillon
flavorText: This Pokémon was born in a mysterious land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

attack.name: Evo-Powder
attack.text: For each of your Benched Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Morelull
flavorText: Pokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull’s head. The caps regrow overnight.

name: Shiinotic

abilities.name: Calming Light
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may make your opponent’s Active Pokémon Asleep.

flavorText: Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing, it drains their vitality with its fingertips.

attack.name: Spiral Rush
attack.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

name: Dhelmise
flavorText: After a piece of seaweed merged with debris from a sunken ship, it was reborn as this ghost Pokémon.

attack.name: Rescue Kedge
attack.text: Put up to 2 Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.

attack.name: Annihilating Anchor
attack.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

name: Zarude
flavorText: Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It’s incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.

attack.name: Leaf Drain
attack.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attack.name: Jungle Whip
attack.text: You may put all Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand to have this attack do 80 more damage.

name: Capsakid
flavorText: Traditional Paldean dishes can be extremely spicy because they include the shed front teeth of Capsakid among their ingredients.

name: Rellor
flavorText: It rolls its mud ball around while the energy it needs for evolution matures. Eventually the time comes for it to evolve.

attack.name: Collect
attack.text: Draw a card.

name: Rabsca
flavorText: An infant sleeps inside the ball. Rabsca rolls the ball soothingly with its legs to ensure the infant sleeps comfortably.

attack.name: Triple Draw
attack.text: Draw 3 cards.

attack.name: Counterturn
attack.text: If there are 3 or fewer cards in your deck, this attack does 200 more damage.

name: Wo-Chien
flavorText: It drains the life-force from vegetation, causing nearby forests to instantly wither and fields to turn barren.

attack.name: Hazardous Greed
attack.text: If there are 3 or fewer cards in your deck, this attack also does 120 damage to 2 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attack.name: Entangling Whip
attack.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

name: Vulpix
flavorText: As its body grows larger, its six warm tails become more beautiful, with a more luxurious coat of fur.

attack.name: Take Down
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Ninetales
flavorText: It has nine long tails and fur that gleams gold. It is said to live for 1,000 years.

attack.name: Fire Soul
attack.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Paldean Tauros
flavorText: People call this kind of Tauros the Blaze Breed due to the hot air it snorts from its nostrils. Its three tails are intertwined.

attack.name: Spirited Tackle
attack.text: If your opponent’s Active Pokémon is a Stage 1 Pokémon, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Ho-Oh
flavorText: A legend says that its body glows in seven colors. A rainbow is said to form behind it when it flies.

attack.name: Shining Blaze
attack.text: If you have any Tera Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Castform Sunny Form
flavorText: This is the form Castform takes on bright days. In an experiment where Castform was placed in front of a heater, it didn’t change to this form.

attack.name: Singe
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attack.name: Sunny Assist
attack.text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Victini

abilities.name: Victory Cheer
abilities.text: Attacks used by your Evolution {R} Pokémon do 10 more damage to your opponent’s Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

attack.text: Attacks used by your Evolution Fire Pokémon do 10 more damage to your opponent’s Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Pansear
flavorText: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.

name: Simisear
flavorText: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

attack.name: Double Smash
attack.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

name: Larvesta
flavorText: In ancient times, Larvesta was worshiped as the emissary of the sun. However, it was also viewed as a burden since it often caused forest fires.

name: Volcarona
flavorText: This Pokémon scatters burning scales. Most of the danger of these scales is not in their heat—it’s in the way they rob the surrounding air of oxygen.

attack.name: Leech Life
attack.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

attack.name: Turbulent Wings
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

name: Oricorio
flavorText: This form of Oricorio has sipped red nectar. It whips up blazing flames as it moves to the steps of its passionate dance.

attack.name: Energy Assist
attack.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attack.name: Fireworks
attack.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Sizzlipede
flavorText: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.

name: Centiskorch
flavorText: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

attack.name: Billowing Heat Wave
attack.text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Fuecoco
flavorText: Its flame sac is small, so energy is always leaking out. This energy is released from the dent atop Fuecoco’s head and flickers to and fro.

attack.name: Heat Burn
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Crocalor
flavorText: The valve in Crocalor’s flame sac is closely connected to its vocal cords. This Pokémon utters a guttural cry as it spews flames every which way.

attack.name: Heat Breath
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

name: Skeledirge

abilities.name: Unaware
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent’s Pokémon done to this Pokémon. (Damage is not an effect.)

flavorText: Skeledirge’s gentle singing soothes the souls of all that hear it. It burns its enemies to a crisp with flames of over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit.

attack.name: Torcherto
attack.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent’s).

name: Charcadet
flavorText: Its firepower increases when it fights, reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. It likes berries that are rich in fat.

name: Charcadet
flavorText: Its firepower increases when it fights, reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. It likes berries that are rich in fat.

attack.name: Flamethrower
attack.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Armarouge
flavorText: This Pokémon clads itself in armor that has been fortified by psychic and fire energy, and it shoots blazing fireballs.

attack.name: Crimson Blaster
attack.text: Discard all Fire Energy from this Pokémon, and this attack does 180 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Ceruledge
flavorText: An old set of armor steeped in grudges caused this Pokémon’s evolution. Ceruledge cuts its enemies to pieces without mercy.

attack.name: Cursed Edge
attack.text: Discard all Special Energy from all of your opponent’s Pokémon.

attack.name: Black Blaze Slash
attack.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can’t attack.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
name: Ceruledge ex

attack.name: Abyssal Flames
attack.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy card in your discard pile.

attack.name: Raging Amethyst
attack.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Scovillain ex

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is {G} and {R} type.

attack.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Grass and Fire type.

attack.name: Spicy Rage
attack.text: This attack does 70 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

name: Gouging Fire
flavorText: There are scant few reports of this creature being sighted. One short video shows it rampaging and spouting pillars of flame.

attack.name: Blazing Charge
attack.text: If your opponent has 4 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Paldean Tauros
flavorText: It swims by jetting water from its horns. The most notable characteristic of the Aqua Breed is its high body fat, which allows it to float easily.

attack.name: Upthrusting Horns
attack.text: You may put 2 Energy attached to your opponent’s Active Stage 2 Pokémon into their hand.

name: Mantine
flavorText: If it builds up enough speed swimming, it can jump out above the waves and glide for over 300 feet.

attack.name: Aqua Dive
attack.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Feebas
flavorText: It is the shabbiest Pokémon of all. It forms schools and lives at the bottom of rivers that teem with plant life.

attack.name: Leap Out
attack.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Milotic ex

abilities.name: Sparkling Scales
abilities.text: Prevent all damage from and effects of attacks from your opponent’s Tera Pokémon done to this Pokémon.

attack.name: Hypno Splash
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Spheal
flavorText: This Pokémon’s body is covered in blubber and impressively round. It’s faster for Spheal to roll around than walk.

attack.name: Powder Snow
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Sealeo
flavorText: Sealeo live on top of drift ice. They go swimming when they’re on the hunt, seeking out their prey by scent.

name: Walrein
flavorText: Walrein form herds of 20 to 30 individuals. When a threat appears, the herd’s leader will protect the group with its life.

attack.name: Frigid Fangs
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, Pokémon that have 2 or less Energy attached can’t attack. (This includes new Pokémon that come into play.)

attack.name: Megaton Fall
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

name: Shellos
flavorText: This Pokémon can often be seen along seashores. It’s capable of spending a limited amount of time on land.

name: Cryogonal
flavorText: Cryogonal uses its chains of ice to constrict its opponents and then flash-freezes them where they stand.

attack.name: Call Sign
attack.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attack.name: Ice Beam
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Black Kyurem ex

attack.name: Ice Age
attack.text: If your opponent’s Active Pokémon is a Dragon Pokémon, it is now Paralyzed.

attack.name: Black Frost
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

name: Bruxish

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent’s Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

flavorText: When sunlight reflects on the ripples created by a Bruxish grinding its teeth, the water all around sparkles brilliantly.

attack.name: Big Bite
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, the Defending Pokémon can’t retreat.

name: Quaxly
flavorText: Its strong legs let it easily swim around in even fast-flowing rivers. It likes to keep things tidy and is prone to overthinking things.

attack.name: Aerial Ace
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Quaxwell
flavorText: The hardworking Quaxwell observes people and Pokémon from various regions and incorporates their movements into its own dance routines.

name: Quaquaval

abilities.name: Up-Tempo
abilities.text: You must put a card from your hand on the bottom of your deck in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

flavorText: Dancing in ways that evoke far-away places, this Pokémon mesmerizes all that see it. Flourishes of its decorative water feathers slice into its foes.

name: Cetoddle
flavorText: It lives in frigid regions in pods of five or so individuals. It loves the minerals found in snow and ice.

attack.name: Draining Fin
attack.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Cetitan

abilities.name: Solid Body
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Ice energy builds up in the horn on its upper jaw, causing the horn to reach cryogenic temperatures that freeze its surroundings.

name: Iron Bundle
flavorText: It resembles a mysterious object mentioned in an old book. There are only two reported sightings of this Pokémon.

attack.name: Gusting Collision
attack.text: This attack does 50 less damage for each Colorless in your opponent’s Active Pokémon’s Retreat Cost.

name: Chien-Pao

abilities.name: Snow Sink
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Stadium in play.

flavorText: The hatred of those who perished by the sword long ago has clad itself in snow and become a Pokémon.

attack.name: Icicle Loop
attack.text: Put an Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
name: Pikachu ex

abilities.name: Resolute Heart
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has full HP and would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, it is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

attack.name: Topaz Bolt
attack.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Magnemite
flavorText: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges electromagnetic waves and so on from the units at its sides.

name: Magneton

abilities.name: Overvolt Discharge
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach up to 3 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your {L} Pokémon in any way you like. If you use this Ability, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

flavorText: They’re formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

attack.text: Once during your turn, you may attach up to 3 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Lightning Pokémon in any way you like. If you use this Ability, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

name: Magnezone
flavorText: Exposure to a special magnetic field changed Magneton’s molecular structure, turning it into Magnezone.

attack.name: Mighty Magnetism
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Confused. During your opponent’s next turn, that Pokémon can’t retreat.

attack.name: Zap Cannon
attack.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can’t use Zap Cannon.

name: Rotom
flavorText: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.

attack.name: Crushing Pulse
attack.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard all Item cards and Pokémon Tool cards you find there.

attack.name: Energy Short
attack.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Energy attached to your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

name: Blitzle
flavorText: This Pokémon prefers places with lots of lightning strikes. It catches lightning with its mane and stores the electricity within its body.

attack.name: Add On
attack.text: Draw a card.

name: Zebstrika
flavorText: Once the herd hears thunder, it chases after the storm clouds so that the Blitzle in the group can use the lightning to charge up.

name: Stunfisk
flavorText: Thanks to bacteria that lived in the mud flats with it, this Pokémon developed the organs it uses to generate electricity.

attack.name: Paralyzing Crackle
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed, and discard an Energy from that Pokémon.

name: Tapu Koko
flavorText: Although it’s called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.

attack.name: Summon Lightning
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attack.name: Prize Count
attack.text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Wattrel
flavorText: These Pokémon make their nests on coastal cliffs. The nests have a strange, crackling texture, and they’re a popular delicacy.

attack.name: Aerial Ace
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Kilowattrel
flavorText: It uses its throat sac to store electricity generated by its wings. There’s hardly any oil in its feathers, so it is a poor swimmer.

attack.name: Storm Bolt
attack.text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Kilowattrel ex

attack.name: Return Charge
attack.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, attach up to 2 Basic Lightning Energy cards from your hand to this Pokémon.

attack.name: Thunder Lance
attack.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Miraidon
flavorText: This seems to be the Iron Serpent mentioned in an old book. The Iron Serpent is said to have turned the land to ash with its lightning.

attack.name: C
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, prevent all damage done to each of your Future Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon ex. If this Pokémon is no longer your Active Pokémon, this effect ends.

name: Togepi
flavorText: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.

name: Togetic
flavorText: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.

attack.name: Draining Kiss
attack.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Togekiss

abilities.name: Wonder Kiss
abilities.text: When your opponent’s Active Pokémon is Knocked Out, flip a coin. If heads, take 1 more Prize card. The effect of Wonder Kiss doesn’t stack.

flavorText: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they’ve hardly been seen at all.

name: Marill
flavorText: The oil-filled tail functions as a buoy, so it’s fine even in rivers with strong currents.

name: Azumarill

abilities.name: Glistening Bubbles
abilities.text: If you have any Tera Pokémon in play, this Pokémon can use the Double-Edge attack for {P}.

flavorText: By keeping still and listening intently, it can tell what is in even wild, fast-moving rivers.

attack.text: If you have any Tera Pokémon in play, this Pokémon can use the Double-Edge attack for Psychic.

attack.name: Double-Edge
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

name: Smoochum
flavorText: If its face gets even slightly dirty, Smoochum will bathe immediately. But if its body gets dirty, Smoochum doesn’t really seem to care.

attack.name: Delightful Kiss
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Psychic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Latias ex

abilities.name: Skyliner
abilities.text: Your Basic Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.

attack.name: Eon Blade
attack.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can’t attack.

name: Latios
flavorText: A highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its wings in flight, it can overtake jet planes.

attack.name: Skill Dive
attack.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Uxie
flavorText: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.

attack.name: Painful Memories
attack.text: Put 2 damage counters on each of your opponent’s Pokémon.

name: Mesprit
flavorText: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

attack.name: Full Heart
attack.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Psychic Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attack.name: Guardian Burst
attack.text: If you don’t have Uxie and Azelf on your Bench, this attack does nothing.

name: Azelf
flavorText: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.

attack.name: Neurokinesis
attack.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on all of your opponent’s Pokémon.

name: Sigilyph
flavorText: Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some say they were the guardians of an ancient city. Others say they were the guardians’ emissaries.

attack.name: Double Draw
attack.text: Draw 2 cards.

attack.name: Psy Bolt
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Yamask
flavorText: It wanders through ruins by night, carrying a mask that’s said to have been the face it had when it was still human.

name: Cofagrigus
flavorText: This Pokémon has a body of sparkling gold. People say it no longer remembers that it was once human.

attack.name: Law of the Underworld
attack.text: Put 6 damage counters on each Pokémon that has an Ability (both yours and your opponent’s).

name: Espurr
flavorText: Behind an Espurr’s expressionless face is a frantic struggle to contain psychic power.

attack.name: See Through
attack.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

name: Meowstic

abilities.name: Beckoning Tail
abilities.text: You must discard a Chill Teaser Toy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may switch in 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

flavorText: If Meowstic continuously emits its powerful psychic energy, it will damage its own body.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
name: Sylveon ex

attack.name: Magical Charm
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do 100 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Angelite
attack.text: Choose 2 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. Shuffle those Pokémon and all attached cards into your opponent’s deck. If 1 of your Pokémon used Angelite during your last turn, this attack can’t be used.

name: Dedenne
flavorText: Dedenne emit electrical waves from the whiskers on their cheeks to communicate with each other. When low on electricity, they curl up and sleep.

attack.name: Electromagnetic Sonar
attack.text: Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Xerneas
flavorText: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.

attack.name: Aurora Gain
attack.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attack.name: Giga Impact
attack.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can’t attack.

name: Oricorio
flavorText: This form of Oricorio has sipped pink nectar. It elevates its mind with the gentle steps of its dance, then unleashes its psychic energy.

attack.name: Energy Assist
attack.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attack.name: Dazzle Dance
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Sandygast
flavorText: It flings sand into the eyes of its prey and tries to close in on them while they’re blinded, but since Sandygast is so slow, the prey tends to escape.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
name: Palossand ex

attack.name: Sand Tomb
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, the Defending Pokémon can’t retreat.

attack.name: Barite Jail
attack.text: Put damage counters on each of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon until its remaining HP is 100.

name: Tapu Lele
flavorText: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.

attack.name: Perplex
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attack.name: Mental Crush
attack.text: If your opponent’s Active Pokémon is Confused, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Indeedee

abilities.name: Obliging Heal
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may heal 30 damage from your Active Pokémon and have it recover from a Special Condition.

flavorText: This Pokémon never leaves its Trainer’s side. It predicts their actions with its psychic power and takes care of their day-to-day needs.

name: Flittle
flavorText: It spends its time running around wastelands. If anyone steals its beloved berries, it will chase them down and exact its revenge.

attack.name: Splashing Dodge
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent’s next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

name: Espathra
flavorText: It emits psychic power from the gaps between its multicolored frills and sprints at speeds greater than 120 mph.

attack.name: Mystical Eyes
attack.text: Devolve 1 of your opponent’s evolved Pokémon by putting the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent’s hand.

attack.name: Spiral Drain
attack.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Flutter Mane
flavorText: This Pokémon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.

attack.name: Perplexing Transfer
attack.text: Move all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Ancient Pokémon to your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

attack.name: Moonblast
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Gimmighoul
flavorText: It lives inside an old treasure chest. Sometimes it gets left in shop corners since no one realizes it’s actually a Pokémon.

attack.name: Minor Errand-Running
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Mankey
flavorText: It is extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away the next instant.

attack.name: Dual Chop
attack.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

name: Primeape
flavorText: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.

attack.name: Sweep the Leg
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

name: Annihilape
flavorText: It imbues its fists with the power of the rage that it kept hidden in its heart. Opponents struck by these imbued fists will be shattered to their core.

attack.name: Tantrum
attack.text: This Pokémon is now Confused.

attack.name: Destined Fight
attack.text: Both Active Pokémon are Knocked Out.

name: Paldean Tauros
flavorText: This kind of Tauros, known as the Combat Breed, is distinguished by its thick, powerful muscles and its fierce disposition.

attack.name: Blocking Stomp
attack.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can’t attack during your opponent’s next turn.

name: Phanpy
flavorText: It is far stronger than it appears. If a Phanpy is swinging its trunk around and your arm gets hit by it, your arm bone will shatter.

name: Donphan
flavorText: Donphan is normally a calm Pokémon, but once it is enraged, it will curl its body into a ball and charge at you while rolling.

attack.name: Knock Flat
attack.text: This attack’s damage isn’t affected by any effects on your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

attack.name: Guarded Rolling
attack.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. During your opponent’s next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Trapinch
flavorText: As it digs through the sand, its giant jaws crush any rocks that obstruct its path. It builds a funnel-shaped nest.

attack.name: Call for Family
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Vibrava
flavorText: It generates ultrasonic waves by vigorously vibrating its wings. After making its prey faint, it dissolves the prey with its digestive juices.

attack.name: Screech
attack.text: During your next turn, the Defending Pokémon takes 50 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
name: Flygon ex

attack.name: Reversing Storm
attack.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attack.name: Sonic Peridot
attack.text: This attack does 100 damage to each of your opponent’s Pokémon ex and Pokémon V. This attack’s damage isn’t affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Gastrodon

abilities.name: Sticky Bind
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, Benched Stage 2 Pokémon (both yours and your opponent’s) have no Abilities.

flavorText: It appears on beaches where the waters are shallow. Once it catches prey, it will slowly melt them with its mucus before slurping them up.

name: Drilbur
flavorText: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.

attack.name: Burrow
attack.text: Discard the top card of your opponent’s deck.

name: Excadrill
flavorText: Its drill, which has evolved into steel, is strong enough to bore through iron plates. This Pokémon is a great help in tunnel construction.

attack.name: Digging Claw
attack.text: Discard the top card of your opponent’s deck.

attack.name: Drill Smash
attack.text: If you have any Metal Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Landorus
flavorText: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”

attack.name: Fist of Focus
attack.text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attack.name: Buster Swing
attack.text: This attack’s damage isn’t affected by Resistance.

name: Passimian
flavorText: The boss chooses 10 members of the group to go out hunting. The hunting party will evenly split the food they find with the rest of the group.

attack.name: Coordinated Throwing
attack.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Basic Pokémon in play.

name: Clobbopus
flavorText: It’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

attack.name: Slight Intrusion
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Grapploct
flavorText: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.

attack.name: Raging Tentacles
attack.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack can be used for Fighting.

name: Glimmet
flavorText: Glimmet’s toxic mineral crystals look just like flower petals. This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder like pollen to protect itself.

attack.name: Rock Hurl
attack.text: This attack’s damage isn’t affected by Resistance.

name: Glimmora
flavorText: Glimmora’s petals are made of crystallized poison energy. It has recently become evident that these petals resemble Tera Jewels.

attack.name: Corrosive Shards
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During your opponent’s next turn, Energy cards can’t be attached from your opponent’s hand to that Pokémon.

name: Koraidon
flavorText: This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.

attack.name: Unrelenting Onslaught
attack.text: If 1 of your other Ancient Pokémon used an attack during your last turn, this attack does 150 more damage.

name: Deino
flavorText: It nests deep inside a cave. Food there is scarce, so Deino will sink its teeth into anything that moves and attempt to eat it.

attack.name: Stomp Off
attack.text: Discard the top card of your opponent’s deck.

name: Zweilous
flavorText: The two heads have different likes and dislikes. Because the heads fight with each other, Zweilous gets stronger without needing to rely on others.

attack.name: Stomp Off
attack.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent’s deck.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
name: Hydreigon ex

attack.name: Crashing Headbutt
attack.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your opponent’s deck.

attack.name: Obsidian
attack.text: This attack also does 130 damage to 2 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Shroodle
flavorText: To keep enemies away from its territory, it paints markings around its nest using a poisonous liquid that has an acrid odor.

name: Grafaiai
flavorText: Each Grafaiai paints its own individual pattern, and it will paint that same pattern over and over again throughout its life.

attack.name: Mischievous Painting
attack.text: Attach up to 3 Energy cards from your opponent’s discard pile to their Pokémon in any way you like.

attack.name: Energized Graffiti
attack.text: This attack does 40 damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent’s Pokémon.

name: Alolan Diglett
flavorText: Its golden whiskers function as sensors. It pokes them out of its burrow to monitor its surroundings.

attack.name: Surprise Attack
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Alolan Dugtrio
flavorText: Its metallic whiskers are heavy, so it’s not very fast, but it has the power to dig through bedrock.

attack.name: Trio-Cheehoo
attack.text: If you don’t have exactly 3 cards in your hand, this attack does nothing.

name: Skarmory
flavorText: Since the feathers that it sheds are thin and sharp, people apparently once used them as swords.

attack.name: Steel Wing
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Registeel
flavorText: Registeel’s body is made of a strange material that is flexible enough to stretch and shrink but also more durable than any metal.

attack.name: Raging Hammer
attack.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

name: Bronzor
flavorText: They are found in ancient tombs. The patterns on their backs are said to be imbued with mysterious power.

attack.name: Shield Attack
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Bronzong
flavorText: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.

attack.name: Double Impact
attack.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

name: Klefki
flavorText: In the past, noble families entrusted their vault keys to a Klefki. They passed the Klefki down through the generations, taking good care of it.

attack.name: Stick ‘n’ Draw
attack.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards.

name: Duraludon
flavorText: Its metal body is durable but prone to retaining heat. It vents this heat from the slits in its tail.

attack.name: Duralubeam
attack.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Archaludon ex

abilities.name: Assemble Alloy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may attach up to 2 Basic {M} Energy cards from your discard pile to your {M} Pokémon in any way you like.

attack.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may attach up to 2 Basic Metal Energy cards from your discard pile to your Metal Pokémon in any way you like.

attack.name: Metal Defender
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

name: Gholdengo
flavorText: It has a sturdy body made up of stacked coins. Gholdengo overwhelms its enemies by firing coin after coin at them in quick succession.

attack.name: Strike It Rich
attack.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Gimmighoul during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attack.name: Surf Back
attack.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

name: Iron Crown
flavorText: There was supposedly an incident in which it launched shining blades to cut everything around it to pieces. Little else is known about it.

attack.name: Deleting Slash
attack.text: If your opponent has 3 or more Benched Pokémon, this attack does 80 more damage.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
name: Alolan Exeggutor ex

attack.name: Tropical Frenzy
attack.text: You may attach any number of Basic Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attack.name: Swinging Sphene
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, Knock Out your opponent’s Active Basic Pokémon. If tails, Knock Out 1 of your opponent’s Benched Basic Pokémon.

name: Altaria
flavorText: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.

attack.name: Humming Charge
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attack.name: Cotton Wings
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent’s next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

name: Dialga
flavorText: A Pokémon spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when Dialga was born.

attack.name: Time Manipulation
attack.text: Search your deck for 2 cards, shuffle your deck, then put those cards on top of it in any order.

name: Palkia
flavorText: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. It appears in mythology.

attack.name: Space Crash
attack.text: This attack does 40 damage for each Basic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Turtonator
flavorText: Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.

attack.name: Fully Singe
attack.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent’s Active Pokémon ex.

name: Applin
flavorText: Applin lives inside an apple. When an Applin is separated from its apple, its body loses moisture and the Pokémon grows weak.

attack.name: Nutrients
attack.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attack.name: Trip Over
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Flapple
flavorText: It uses its own body fluid to repair its apple. Strong Flapple that have won many battles have apples that are clay colored all over.

attack.name: Acidic Spit
attack.text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

name: Appletun
flavorText: When some Lechonk come along to lick the sweet nectar on Appletun’s back, Appletun will spew sticky nectar at them to drive them away.

attack.name: Melting Sweetness
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, the Defending Pokémon can’t attack.

attack.name: Wild Tackle
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

name: Eternatus
flavorText: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.

attack.name: Dyna-Blast
attack.text: If your opponent’s Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex, this attack does 80 more damage.

attack.name: World Ender
attack.text: Discard a Stadium in play. If you can’t, this attack does nothing.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
name: Tatsugiri ex

attack.name: Surprise Pump
attack.text: This attack’s damage isn’t affected by any effects on your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

attack.name: Cinnabar Lure
attack.text: Look at the top 10 cards of your deck. You may put any number of Pokémon you find there onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Eevee

abilities.name: Boosted Evolution
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, it can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

flavorText: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element stones.

attack.name: Reckless Charge
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Snorlax
flavorText: Its stomach’s digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. Eating things off the ground doesn’t bother it at all.

attack.name: Spike Draw
attack.text: Draw a card.

name: Slakoth
flavorText: The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.

attack.name: Take It Easy
attack.text: Heal 60 damage from this Pokémon. During your next turn, this Pokémon can’t retreat.

name: Vigoroth
flavorText: It is always hungry because it won’t stop rampaging. Even while it is eating, it can’t keep still.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Slaking ex

abilities.name: Born to Slack
abilities.text: If your opponent has no Pokémon ex or Pokémon V in play, this Pokémon can’t attack.

attack.name: Great Swing
attack.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Swablu
flavorText: It can’t relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes off dirt with its wings.

attack.name: Disarming Voice
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Zangoose
flavorText: If it comes across a Seviper, its fur bristles and it assumes its battle pose. Its sharp claws are its best weapon.

attack.name: Fury Cutter
attack.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 50 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Kecleon

abilities.name: Expert Hider
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

flavorText: It changes its hue to blend into its surroundings. If no one takes notice of it for too long, it will pout and never reveal itself.

attack.name: Lick Whip
attack.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Bouffalant
flavorText: These Pokémon can crush a car with no more than a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on their heads hold higher positions within the herd.

attack.name: Ready to Ram
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 6 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attack.name: Smashing Headbutt
attack.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Rufflet
flavorText: With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces its prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also consumes berries, it’s a carnivore at heart.

name: Braviary
flavorText: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.

attack.name: Drag Off
attack.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot. This attack does 40 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

name: Helioptile
flavorText: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon’s electric moves.

attack.name: Reckless Charge
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Heliolisk
flavorText: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.

attack.name: Parabolic Charge
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 4 Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Oranguru
flavorText: This Pokémon lives quietly in the depths of the forest. The purple, cape-like fur gets longer and longer as Oranguru ages.

attack.name: Now You’re in My Power
attack.text: Until the end of your next turn, the Defending Pokémon’s Weakness is now Colorless. (The amount of Weakness doesn’t change.)

name: Tandemaus
flavorText: The pair sticks together no matter what. They split any food they find exactly in half and then eat it together.

attack.name: Play Rough
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

name: Maushold
flavorText: The larger pair protects the little ones during battles. When facing strong opponents, the whole group will join the fight.

attack.name: Familial March
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Maushold and Maushold ex and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attack.name: Incessant Incisors
attack.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).

attack.name: Break Through
attack.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Flamigo ex

attack.name: Brave Bird
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

name: Terapagos
flavorText: The shell is made of crystallized Terastal energy. When struck by a move, this shell absorbs the move’s energy and transfers it to Terapagos.

abilities.text: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to a Pokémon, draw 4 cards.

name: Exeggcute
flavorText: Using telepathy only fellow Exeggcute can pick up on, they always form a cluster of six.

attack.name: Precocious Evolution
attack.text: If you go first, you can use this attack during your first turn. Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Vivillon
flavorText: This Pokémon was born in a mysterious land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

attack.name: Evo-Powder
attack.text: For each of your Benched Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Shiinotic

abilities.name: Calming Light
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may make your opponent’s Active Pokémon Asleep.

flavorText: Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing, it drains their vitality with its fingertips.

attack.name: Spiral Rush
attack.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

name: Castform Sunny Form
flavorText: This is the form Castform takes on bright days. In an experiment where Castform was placed in front of a heater, it didn’t change to this form.

attack.name: Singe
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attack.name: Sunny Assist
attack.text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Larvesta
flavorText: In ancient times, Larvesta was worshiped as the emissary of the sun. However, it was also viewed as a burden since it often caused forest fires.

name: Ceruledge
flavorText: An old set of armor steeped in grudges caused this Pokémon’s evolution. Ceruledge cuts its enemies to pieces without mercy.

attack.name: Cursed Edge
attack.text: Discard all Special Energy from all of your opponent’s Pokémon.

attack.name: Black Blaze Slash
attack.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can’t attack.

name: Feebas
flavorText: It is the shabbiest Pokémon of all. It forms schools and lives at the bottom of rivers that teem with plant life.

attack.name: Leap Out
attack.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Spheal
flavorText: This Pokémon’s body is covered in blubber and impressively round. It’s faster for Spheal to roll around than walk.

attack.name: Powder Snow
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Bruxish

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent’s Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

flavorText: When sunlight reflects on the ripples created by a Bruxish grinding its teeth, the water all around sparkles brilliantly.

attack.name: Big Bite
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, the Defending Pokémon can’t retreat.

name: Cetitan

abilities.name: Solid Body
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Ice energy builds up in the horn on its upper jaw, causing the horn to reach cryogenic temperatures that freeze its surroundings.

name: Stunfisk
flavorText: Thanks to bacteria that lived in the mud flats with it, this Pokémon developed the organs it uses to generate electricity.

attack.name: Paralyzing Crackle
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed, and discard an Energy from that Pokémon.

name: Latios
flavorText: A highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its wings in flight, it can overtake jet planes.

attack.name: Skill Dive
attack.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Mesprit
flavorText: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

attack.name: Full Heart
attack.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Psychic Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attack.name: Guardian Burst
attack.text: If you don’t have Uxie and Azelf on your Bench, this attack does nothing.

name: Phanpy
flavorText: It is far stronger than it appears. If a Phanpy is swinging its trunk around and your arm gets hit by it, your arm bone will shatter.

name: Vibrava
flavorText: It generates ultrasonic waves by vigorously vibrating its wings. After making its prey faint, it dissolves the prey with its digestive juices.

attack.name: Screech
attack.text: During your next turn, the Defending Pokémon takes 50 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Clobbopus
flavorText: It’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

attack.name: Slight Intrusion
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Alolan Dugtrio
flavorText: Its metallic whiskers are heavy, so it’s not very fast, but it has the power to dig through even the hardest bedrock.

attack.name: Trio-Cheehoo
attack.text: If you don’t have exactly 3 cards in your hand, this attack does nothing.

name: Skarmory
flavorText: Since the feathers that it sheds are thin and sharp, people apparently once used them as swords.

attack.name: Steel Wing
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Flapple
flavorText: It uses its own body fluid to repair its apple. Strong Flapple that have won many battles have apples that are clay colored all over.

attack.name: Acidic Spit
attack.text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

name: Appletun
flavorText: When some Lechonk come along to lick the sweet nectar on Appletun’s back, Appletun will spew sticky nectar at them to drive them away.

attack.name: Melting Sweetness
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, the Defending Pokémon can’t attack.

attack.name: Wild Tackle
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

name: Slakoth
flavorText: The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.

attack.name: Take It Easy
attack.text: Heal 60 damage from this Pokémon. During your next turn, this Pokémon can’t retreat.

name: Kecleon

abilities.name: Expert Hider
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

flavorText: It changes its hue to blend into its surroundings. If no one takes notice of it for too long, it will pout and never reveal itself.

attack.name: Lick Whip
attack.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Braviary
flavorText: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.

attack.name: Drag Off
attack.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot. This attack does 40 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Durant ex

abilities.name: Sudden Shearing
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard the top card of your opponent’s deck.

attack.name: Vengeful Crush
attack.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Scovillain ex

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is {G} and {R} type.

attack.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Grass and Fire type.

attack.name: Spicy Rage
attack.text: This attack does 70 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Milotic ex

abilities.name: Sparkling Scales
abilities.text: Prevent all damage from and effects of attacks from your opponent’s Tera Pokémon done to this Pokémon.

attack.name: Hypno Splash
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Black Kyurem ex

attack.name: Ice Age
attack.text: If your opponent’s Active Pokémon is a Dragon Pokémon, it is now Paralyzed.

attack.name: Black Frost
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
name: Pikachu ex

abilities.name: Resolute Heart
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has full HP and would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, it is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

attack.name: Topaz Bolt
attack.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Latias ex

abilities.name: Skyliner
abilities.text: Your Basic Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.

attack.name: Eon Blade
attack.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can’t attack.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
name: Palossand ex

attack.name: Sand Tomb
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, the Defending Pokémon can’t retreat.

attack.name: Barite Jail
attack.text: Put damage counters on each of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon until its remaining HP is 100.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
name: Flygon ex

attack.name: Reversing Storm
attack.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attack.name: Sonic Peridot
attack.text: This attack does 100 damage to each of your opponent’s Pokémon ex and Pokémon V. This attack’s damage isn’t affected by Weakness or Resistance.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
name: Hydreigon ex

attack.name: Crashing Headbutt
attack.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your opponent’s deck.

attack.name: Obsidian
attack.text: This attack also does 130 damage to 2 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Archaludon ex

abilities.name: Assemble Alloy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may attach up to 2 Basic {M} Energy cards from your discard pile to your {M} Pokémon in any way you like.

attack.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may attach up to 2 Basic Metal Energy cards from your discard pile to your Metal Pokémon in any way you like.

attack.name: Metal Defender
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, Knock Out your opponent’s Active Basic Pokémon. If tails, Knock Out 1 of your opponent’s Benched Basic Pokémon.

name: Tatsugiri ex

attack.name: Surprise Pump
attack.text: This attack’s damage isn’t affected by any effects on your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

attack.name: Cinnabar Lure
attack.text: Look at the top 10 cards of your deck. You may put any number of Pokémon you find there onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Slaking ex

abilities.name: Born to Slack
abilities.text: If your opponent has no Pokémon ex or Pokémon V in play, this Pokémon can’t attack.

attack.name: Great Swing
attack.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

attack.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attack.name: Zircon Road
attack.text: You may draw 5 cards.

abilities.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon ex, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Drasna

abilities.name: Effect
abilities.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, flip a coin. If heads, draw 8 cards. If tails, draw 3 cards.

name: Drayton

abilities.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon and a Trainer card you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

rules: · Stadium rule: You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can’t be played.

rules: · Item rule: You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
